class newsapp.forms.ArticleForm(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: ModelForm

Form for creating and updating Article objects. Fields: - title: CharField for the title. - content: CharField for the content. - author: CharField for the author of article.

Meta class: - Defines the model to use (Article) and the fields to include in the form. :param forms.ModelForm: Django’s ModelForm class.

newsapp.models module

class newsapp.models.Article(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

Model representing an Article

Fields: -title: charfield with a max length of 255 -content: textfield with no max limit -status: charfield with a max length of 20, choices=draft, pending,

published, rejected, default choice=draft

-is_approved: boleanfield, default=Flase -created_at: Dtae time field, auto_add -updated_at: Dtae time field, auto_add

Relationships: -author: -publisher Methods: __str__: Returns a string representation of the article, showing the title

Parameters:

models.Model – Django’s base model class.

exception DoesNotExist

Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned

Bases: MultipleObjectsReturned

exception NotUpdated

Bases: ObjectNotUpdated, DatabaseError

author

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one (via ForwardOneToOneDescriptor subclass) relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

author_id

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

independent_author

Accessor to the related objects manager on the forward and reverse sides of a many-to-many relation.

In the example:

class Pizza(Model):
    toppings = ManyToManyField(Topping, related_name='pizzas')

Pizza.toppings and Topping.pizzas are ManyToManyDescriptor instances.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

is_approved

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

objects = <django.db.models.manager.Manager object>

class newsapp.models.Newsletter(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

Model representing an Article

Fields: -title: charfield with a max length of 255 -description: textfield with no max length -subject: textfield with no max limit -status: charfield with a max length of 20, choices=draft, pending,

published, rejected, default choice=draft

-is_approved: boleanfield, default=Flase -created_at: Dtae time field, auto_add -updated_at: Dtae time field, auto_add -is_active: booleanfield, default=True

Relationships: -author -publisher Methods: __str__: Returns a string representation of the article, showing the title

Parameters:

models.Model – Django’s base model class.

newsapp.urls module

newsapp.views module

newsapp.views.announce_article_on_x(article_id)[source]

View to announce an article on X (formerly Twitter).

Parameters:

article_id – ID of the article to be announced.

Returns:

None. Posts a text-only announcement to X if the article exists.

newsapp.views.approve_article(request, pk)[source]

View to display approve a specific article. :param request: HTTP request object. :param pk: Primary key of the article. :return: Redirect to article_list.

newsapp.views.approve_newsletter(request, pk)[source]

View to display approve a specific newsletter. :param request: HTTP request object. :param pk: Primary key of the newsletter. :return: Redirect to newsletter_list.

newsapp.views.article_delete(request, pk)[source]

View to delete an existing article. :param request: HTTP request object. :param pk: Primary key of the article to be deleted. :return: Redirect to the article list after deletion.

newsapp.views.article_detail(request, pk)[source]

View to display details of a specific article. :param request: HTTP request object. :param pk: Primary key of the article. :return: Rendered template with details of the specified article.

newsapp.views.article_list(request)[source]

This view will display a list of articles/newsletters

param request:

HTTP object

return:

Rendered template with a list of articles/newsletters

newsapp.views.article_update(request, pk)[source]

View to update an existing article. :param request: HTTP request object. :param pk: Primary key of the article to be updated. :return: Rendered template for updating the specified article.

newsapp.views.confirm_subscription(request, pk)[source]

View to confirm subscription to an individual journalist or publisher. Only allows readers to subsribe

Parameters:

  • request – HTTP request object.

  • pk – Primary key of the article

Returns:

Redirects to reader_subsription.

newsapp.views.create_article(request)[source]

View to create a new article. :param request: HTTP request object. :return: Rendered template for creating a new article.

newsapp.views.dashboard(request)[source]

Redirects the user to the appropriate dashboard based on their role. Assumes you have defined these names in your urls.py.

newsapp.views.editor_dashboard(request)[source]

View for the editor dashboard.

Parameters:

request – HTTP request object.

Returns:

Renders the editor dashboard for editor users. Redirects non-editor users to the main dashboard.

newsapp.views.journalist_dashboard(request)[source]

View for the journalist dashboard.

Parameters:

request – HTTP request object.

Returns:

Renders the journalist dashboard for journalist users. Redirects non-journalist users to the main dashboard.

newsapp.views.newsletter_create(request)[source]

View to create a new newsletter. :param request: HTTP request object. :param pk: Primary key of the newsletter. :return: Redirect to the article list after creation.

newsapp.views.newsletter_delete(request, pk)[source]

View to delete an existing newsletter. :param request: HTTP request object. :param pk: Primary key of the newsletter to be deleted. :return: Redirect to the newslleter list after deletion.

newsapp.views.newsletter_detail(request, pk)[source]

View to display details of a specific newsletter. :param request: HTTP request object. :param pk: Primary key of the newsletter. :return: Rendered template with details of the specified newsletter.

View for the reader dashboard.

request – HTTP request object.

newsapp.views.reject_newsletter(request, pk)[source]

View to display reject a specific newsletter. :param request: HTTP request object. :param pk: Primary key of the newsletter. :return: Redirect to newsletter_list.

newsapp.views.subscribe(request, pk)[source]

View to subscribe to an individual journalist or publisher.

Parameters:

  • request – HTTP request object.

  • pk – Primary key of the article

Returns:

Redirects to confirm_subsription.

newsapp.views.subscribed_articles(request, *args, **kwargs)[source]

API view to get all articles/newsletters of publishers or independent journalists that the user may be subscribed to.

Parameters:

  • request – HTTP request object.

  • pk – Primary key of the article.

Returns:

Json response.

newsapp.views.unsub_to_journalist(request, pk)[source]

View to unsubscribe to an individual journalist.

Parameters:

  • request – HTTP request object.

  • pk – Primary key of the article.

Returns:

Redirects to reader_dashboard.

newsapp.views.unsub_to_publisher(request, pk)[source]

View to unsubscribe to a publisher.

Parameters:

  • request – HTTP request object.

  • pk – Primary key of the article.

Returns:

Redirects to reader_dashboard.

View for editors to access the publication drafts and active edits.
